name: Le Suite di Via Ottaviano

reviews.text: I found this hotel through the wonderful TripAdvisor! It was the perfect place for my family of four adults. We needed a comfortable and clean place to sleep and shower. We were on a budget and this was affordable and included great service along with a fantastic view. We all had nice hot showers. We stayed in a "family" room with a large double bed and bunk beds. My 30 year old son found the top bunk very comfortable. (I wanted a close family vacation and I got it)! No, you will not find a pool, gym, huge rooms, or a dining room - you will find a great location with comfortable beds and an owner who will go out of his way to help you. The breakfast in the morning was more than enough to get us started. Email the owner for precise directions so that you can give them to your taxi driver - this helped us tremendously - this was our first trip to Italy and we made one HUGE mistake - we overpacked! It was a major problem pulling (dragging) our luggage from Rome to Venice to Empoli and then back home! It was difficult fitting the luggage on the trains as well.
reviews.title: Perfect for our family

likes.liked: — Close to Vatican, great restaurants, comfortable beds

reviews.text: I don't even rememeber how I stumbled across this hotel (booked it through laterooms.com in the end) but like the previous reviewer, it seemed to be relatively cheap (compared to the prices of hotels that would be classed as more central ie close to the Trevi fountain etc) and had very good reviews.
reviews.title: Good bed :-)

reviews.text: I was very pleasantly suprised when I arrived.
reviews.title: Lovely Accomodation

reviews.text: Just returned from Le suite di via ottaviano 3rd December and we had a fabulous time. The accommodation is wonderful and the location superb being very close to both the vatican and only two blocks from the metro. The rooms were spotless and beautifully decorated in reds and golds with gorgeous light fittings and accesories. There was a full size fridge which was great and the only thing we would have liked was a kettle and tea and coffee making facilities but I had noticed other people had mentioned this so I took a travel kettle. The breakfast in the coffee shop accross the road is brilliant and gives you a real feel for the Roman experience. We would definately recommend this accommodation but would also like to just point out that it isn't a hotel as such and there are no public areas like sitting rooms a bar or reception, it is merely a room only basis, but what beautiful rooms.
reviews.title: Priceless little palace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: European hotels often don't cater to American tastes, but this one fit us superbly. Sparkling clean, beautiflly decorated, with impressively soundproofed windows, and with spacious bathrooms with jaccuzi tubs (wonderful after a long day of hiking around the city). The location is marvelous: literally five minutes to St Peters by foot, in a neighborood with plenty of restaurants, shops, fastfood and bar/cafes. Minutes to buses that take you straight across the Tiber to the heart of ancient Rome, and minutes to the Metro that goes about anywhere a tourist would want. The staff (both of them) are very pleasnt and helpful. The breakfast at a real Italian cafe/bar is a fun experience, lining up along the bar with the real Romans for capuccino and a croissant. This place is a gem (even moreso for the price). We will stay there agian next time we visit Rome.
reviews.title: Superb little gem!
Fantastic Location
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights to celebrate my 40th Birthday. The owner organised taxis from and to the airport, although we knew we had to pay 40 euros each way, and was there to greet us when we arrived at 1am. He did not charge us for our use of the mini-bar which was about 7 euros.

reviews.title: Great Place/Location
reviews.text: We were lucky enough to be in St Peters when the new Pope was elected and we could not have had a more convenient or exciting place to stay.
I stay in 4 star hotels 2 - 3 times per week and have to say that this little gem put them all to shame. Lovely decor, spotlessly clean and a perfect location.
reviews.title: Great little place to stay

reviews.text: Our first night was spent across the piazza in a similar set of apartments due to problems with the bathroom in the room we had booked. Because of this we were apparently upgraded to the best room in the suite -certainly the one with the best view -although this wasn't available until lunchtime on our second day. Nevertheless, the room was spacious, clean, and had a decent bathroom with a proper shower (no bath), whilst the owner was extremely helpful in highlighting local restaurants and transport links.
reviews.title: Great location, attentive service

reviews.text: Location is excellent, 5 minutes away from St Peter's Basilica in a quiet and safe area. We walked to the centre of Rome everyday (20-30 minutes) but transport links-bus and metro-were very closeby.
reviews.title: Great Location, Nice Room

reviews.text: The 'hotel' offers a taxi service from the airport which is pricey (45 euros each way) but worth the hassle of travelling by bus -especially if you fancy being driven through Rome in a mercedes.
reviews.title: Lovely Accommodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Selected This Hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews. The reviews were accurate. Room was clean, as was the bathroom. Some rooms have bathtubs, and others have showers. We got a room with a shower, but it was not facing the street, so it was very quiet. The location to the Vatican is perfect (a 10 minute easy walk). It is a 4 minute walk to the Metro (subway), which takes you wherever you want to go in Rome (will get you to all the tourist sites). They bring you a Continental Breakfast in your room (you tell them the time), and all the beverages, etc. in the refrigerator were less expensive than you could find in the street). This is a small thing, but it is nice when a hotel does not rip you off for the mini bar. Upon your arrival you are greeted at the door of the Hotel (4th floor of a commercial/residential building (don't worry it has an elevator). I should also note that it was very easy to get to the Hotel via the Metro from the Rome Termini Train Station (Romes main train station). If you have alot of luggage, you will be better off taking a taxi (we did not have alot of luggage). In summary, if you are looking for a clean, secure location to stay (not to hang out at, but to get a good nights sleep and "get out to the sites everyday." This is a good choice. If you are looking for a place to hangout, there is no lobby, breakfast room, or any other place to stay except in your room, so this would not be the place for you. Also, you cannot dial out for local calls on the phones in the rooms, so you will need to use their phone in their little office near the entrance. Simply ask them, and they will let you use it. They also prefer Credit Cards and did not accept travelers checks.
reviews.title: Great Value Right near the Vatican

reviews.text: We enjoyed our 6 night stay at this little hotel--essentially an apartment suite turned into a small hotel in a residential/commercial building a couple of blocks from the Vatican. The room was small but nicely appointed and felt warm--many of the other hotels we stayed in had larger rooms but felt "cold". The jacuzzi tub was a nice touch. It was kept very clean by the Filipino assistant who also spoke very good English (which was very helpful because the owner's English was primitive). We felt very safe in the neighborhood with tons of cabarineri around. The windows kept the noise out nicely. The only complaint is that on our last night we had very loud neighbors. We did not realize how thin the walls were until then. Overall would recommend this hotel. It's reasonably priced, convenient to public transportation, and very pleasant.
reviews.title: Excellent stay
fantastic place!!!
reviews.text: we stayed three nights and loved it. Abolutely spotless, you could eat your dinner of the floor. The bed was fantastically comfortable and the jacuzzi bath was fab! It is really well located, close to the ottaviano metro station and to St Peters and the Vatican museums. we were a bit worried about the breakfast having read the other reviews, but that was actually the best bit! You really get to live like an italian as you join them in the coffee shop for a coffee and a choice of delicious pastries. Yes, its stand-up, but that all adds to the fun. The coffee shop also sells a lovely range of foods and wines. We would definitely stay here again if we go back to Rome.

reviews.title: A bit of luxury...
reviews.text: Well, what can I say, I was simply shocked at most reviews when using TripAdvisor to find a decent place to stay in Rome last month. Unless I was prepared to fork out a small fortune for a decent place, most 3 & 4 star hotels priced at a reasonable price seemed to have reviews warning me to stay away. I've been to quite a few European cities, and I'm used to small rooms that you can't swing a cat in, but hey I can live with that. What I can't stand is horrible, dirty rooms, with unpleasant customer service...and that seemed to sum up the hotel reviews in Rome.

Then I stumbled on the Ottaviano Suites. It was classed as a B&B when I booked, but in reality it's rather like a small boutique hotel. The suites were ideally located, within a one minute walk to the Vatican and a two minute walk to the train stop that will take you to all the other sites in Rome. It will take you about 20/30 minutes to walk to the centre of Rome, and I'd recommend doing it - you see so much more of the city this way. The room was spotlessly clean on our arrival, and it was kept that way every day too. The bed was fantastically comfortable. The whole suite and the bathroom exuded a plush, luxurious feel. We had breakfast (included in the price) either in the little bar down on the street, opposite the suite, or in the room, if arranged the evening before with the suite's owner. The owner (Angelo) was very helpful, although communication wasn't the easiest as we couldn't speak Italian, and the owner's English was a tad rusty. When we arrived Angelo gave us a map of Rome, and pointed out all the bus/trams routes for us to take to see the main visitor sites and recommended a few places to eat. On the last day of our visit, Angelo also arranged a taxi back to the airport for 40 Euros, he gave us a choice of paying him or the taxi driver so chose to pay Angelo. The next day a taxi was waiting for us without having the hassle of haggling a price with the taxi driver. All in all, a very good choice when staying in Rome, with good customer service added at no extra cost.
reviews.title: great room, but---
A unusual little gem!
reviews.text: The room was beautiful and very close to the vatican and metro. Very clean and well maintained. Adequate continental breakfast accross the street, but not before 8 am. However, be aware that the owners English is limited and that he does not stay on site, so you MUST make arrangements so that he will be at the facility when you arrive or there is no way to contact him to get into the building. Also his web site advertises that he accepts credit cards but he really wants cash, though the reservation is confirmed with a credit card. He also advertises that he provides COMPLIMENTARY transportation to or from Termini station, but in fact he does not and acts as though he does not understand, perhaps he does not. Would definitely stay again.

aka: Le Suite Di Via Ottaviano Hotel Rome
